user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_DirectoryClose:
```c
int32 OS_DirectoryClose(osal_id_t dir_id)
{
    OS_object_token_t token;
    int32             return_code;

    /* Make sure the file descriptor is legit before using it */
    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_EXCLUSIVE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, dir_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_DirClose_Impl(&token);

        /* Complete the operation via the common routine */
        return_code = OS_ObjectIdFinalizeDelete(return_code, &token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_EXCLUSIVE, LOCAL_OBJID_TYPE, dir_id, &token);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The address of a local OS_object_token_t is passed to OS_ObjectIdGetById as an output parameter (&token) so the function is expected to modify the pointed-to object. Rule 8.13 recommends const qualification only when the pointed-to object does not need to be modified; here the pointer must be non-const to allow the function to populate/modify token. If, however, OS_ObjectIdGetById does not modify token, its prototype should be changed to take a pointer-to-const.
